camera-save-prefix.tooltip: Don't include file extension. %TYPE is area, window, etc. E.g. %Y-%M-%D-%H%I = 2014-05-25-1848.png. Use %S for seconds, %m for milliseconds

include-cursor.tooltip: Whether to include mouse cursor in screenshot

use-timer.tooltip: Whether to use a timer before capturing

delay-seconds.tooltip: How many seconds to wait before taking a screenshot

show-capture-timer.tooltip: Whether to show the timer on the screen

kb-cs-ui.description: Keybinding to capture a UI element:

capture-window-as-area.description: Capture window as area (suggested, or shots may be black or distorted)
capture-window-as-area.tooltip: Whether to use area selection for window captures

include-window-frame.tooltip: Whether to include the window frame and titlebar in window captures

use-camera-flash.tooltip: Whether to show a bright flash over the capture area

include-styles.description: Include applied styles in UI capture
include-styles.tooltip: Whether to include CSS selection styles in Cinnamon UI screenshots

use-symbolic-icon.description: Use symbolic (black and white) icon for applet
use-symbolic-icon.tooltip: Whether to use symbolic (black and white) icon for applet

play-shutter-sound.tooltip: Whether to play the shutter sound as the capture is made

play-timer-interval-sound.tooltip: Whether to play the timer interval sound as the timer counts down

copy-to-clipboard.tooltip: Whether to copy path/filename of screenshots to clipboard after capture

show-copy-toggle.description: Show toggle button for copying image to clipboard
show-copy-toggle.tooltip: Whether to show another toggle button in the menu for copying image to clipboard. If you have notifications enabled you probably don't need this set.

copy-data-auto-off.description: Turn off copy image toggle after capture
copy-data-auto-off.tooltip: When set, the copy image to clipboard toggle button override will be turned off after a successful capture

copy-data.tooltip: This overrides the 'Copy to clipboard' setting

show-upload-toggle.description: Show toggle button for uploading image to imgur.com
show-upload-toggle.tooltip: Whether to show another toggle button in the menu for automatically uploading. If you have notifications enabled you probably don't need this set.

upload-auto-off.description: Turn off image upload toggle after capture
upload-auto-off.tooltip: When set, the upload to imgur toggle button will be turned off after a successful capture

upload-to-imgur.tooltip: If enabled, all captures will be uploaded to imgur. The view and delete URLs for each capture are stored in a file imgur.log in the capture save directory.

send-notification.tooltip: Whether to send a notification to desktop after capture

notification-behavior.tooltip: The behavior to use when clicking on the notification bubble after a screenshot is taken.

show-copy-path-action.tooltip: If checked, a button will be shown in the notification that allows you to copy the screenshot path to clipboard

show-copy-data-action.description: Enable copying image data from notification
show-copy-data-action.tooltip: If checked, a button will be shown in the notification that allows you to copy the screenshot data to clipboard

show-delete-action.tooltip: If checked, a delete button will be shown in the notification that allows you to remove the screenshot from disk.

show-upload-action.tooltip: If checked, a upload button will be shown in the notification that allows you to quickly upload the image.

demo-notification-button.description: Click here to send an example notification
demo-notification-button.tooltip: Pressing this button will send an example notification with all actions disabled.

open-after.tooltip: Whether to open the screenshot in file manager

label-recorder-settings.description: Please note not all recorders may respect these settings.

recorder-save-prefix.tooltip: Format for built-in recorder. E.g. %Y-%M-%D-%H%I = 2014-05-25-1848.webm. Use %S for seconds, %m for milliseconds

kb-recorder-stop.tooltip: Will start only Cinnamon Recorder. Will stop any recorder using its stop-command.

last-selected-page.description: Last selected page (tab index) of settings application

last-selected-subpage.description: Last selected sub-page (tab index) of settings application
